sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Incident response policy; pro</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization develops an incident response plan that:(i) Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability;(ii) Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability;(iii) Pr</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate; Low</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The organization: a. Develops an incident response plan that: 1. Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability; 2. Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability; 3. Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization; 4. Meets the unique requirements of the organization, which relate to mission, size, structure, and functions; 5. Defines reportable incidents; 6. Provides metrics for measuring the incident response capability within the organization; 7. Defines the resources and management support needed to effectively maintain and mature an incident response capability; and 8. Is reviewed and approved by the applicable Incident Response Team Leader; b. Distributes copies of the incident response plan to: - CMS Chief Information Security Officer; - CMS Chief Information Officer; - Information System Security Officer; - CMS Office of the Inspector General/Computer Crimes Unit; - All personnel within the organization Incident Response Team; - All personnel within the PII Breach Response Team; and - All personnel within the organization Operations Centers. c. Reviews the incident response plan within every three hundred sixty-five (365) days; d. Updates the incident response plan to address system/organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing; e. Communicates incident response plan changes to the organizational elements listed in b. above; and f. Protects the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Incident Response">9987f9fcdb211010280df36f29961963</control_family> <control_name>Incident Response Plan</control_name> <control_number>IR-08</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>IR-08</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>true</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0011029</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:26</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; NIST SP: 800-61; 45 C.F.R. ยง164.308(a)(6) C.F.R.</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>MP-2, MP-4, MP-5, SE-2</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>It is important that organizations develop and implement a coordinated approach to incident response.
